review.title: Dirtiness everywhere
review.reviewText: The hotel staff could be ok but the restaurant staff doesn't care at all. The building is old and it looks like lacks of maintenance, old furniture, dirty rooms, dirty beddings old and stinky bathrooms, the disgusting smell is quite strong. I would not go again.

review.title: Nice Hotel, good location in Centro Historico
review.reviewText:
This is a clean, comfortable hotel in the Centro Historico.  The room was large, clean and comfortable.  The bathroom could use an update, and the shower pressure was weak.  There is no a/c, but good air circulation from windows in bedroom and bathroom.  Our room was on the North side of the building, which was comfortable temperature wise..  They were also experiencing some problems with elevators acting up,  Hotel restaurant has a typical Mexican breakfast buffet, which was good and reasonably priced.  

If you want a 5 star hotel, this isn't for you.  If you want clean comfortable accommodation as a base for walking/touring, give it a try
review.positiveRemarks:
good location, for walking/exploring. 
clean and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms would benefit from an update
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Zocalo, and Centro Historico.  Zona Rosa is about 3.4 km, Chapultapec Castle about 5km.

review.title: Gets the job done
review.reviewText: It is a basics hotel.  When in Mexico city all you need is a place to sleep and shower.  This hotel gets the job done.  Love their shower!!! Its very wide water works excellent.  Beds are hard enough, remember that you dont want soft beds when you really want to rest...Location is great, half a block from Alameda central, and about 150 yards from Palacio de Bellas Artes and Historic District.  If you like fancy hotels, then this is not for you...but if you are a traveler that loves to explore and visit great cities, then you will be pleased...
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location....oh and shower, and bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Its a little outdated, but gets job done.

review.title: Nice hotel staff
review.reviewText: hotel is quiet but outside there are city cleaning trucks that park with engine on almost all nights so you can hear that noise.
review.locationRemarks: its is near many historic places

review.title: Do not trust the pictures
review.reviewText: The hotel looks completely different than the pictures. I couldn't believe it was the same hotel. The bathrooms smelled terribly and the bed was extremely uncomfortable.

review.title: I was surprised in a bad way.
review.reviewText: I thought this hotel could be a bit better. Floor was dirty, bathroom looked very old.

review.title: no fans
review.reviewText: room full of mosqitos with window open,too hot closed.it took sometime for  me to buy a fan .then it was much better.
review.negativeRemarks: ceiling fans or go buy a small one ,the electrical shops  are very close by. 2500 pesos

review.title: I wouldn't go back to this hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel smells terrible and it is very dirty. The room's carpet was full of dirt. The internet was not working all the time neither the cable. The room is dark and cold, and the bathroom smells filthy. Everytime  that we  asked  for towells the stuff ignored us.

review.title: Close to many attractions
review.reviewText: The room was clean and spacious. The shower was terrible with the taps being below the knees and dirt coming out of the walls when you turn the shower on. Bell boy was quite annoying.

review.title: Closeby hotel to tourist spots.
review.reviewText: Hotel is worth what you pay for. The only downside is that eventhough it'a a smoke free location it seems it wasn't that way in the past. There's a heavy cigarette smell in the hotel's hallways and a bit lighter in the rooms. At the end of the day what you need the room is to rest a couple of hours in order to continue touring, so the location fullfills that purpose. Very kind staff. Hotel is located on a very centric and secure area. Recommended.

review.title: a lot place's to visit,near
review.reviewText: nothing about my room reservation,,, i did, reservation for, two rooms, with a one king size bed,,,, each one, for 4 adults,,,, they give me a two rooms, wirh two small beds....when i went to ask at the front desk, they told me the. nobody know nothing about it,,,,,,.....one room was dirty,......
review.positiveRemarks: taxi services is fast and nice driver's......restaurant is really bad....
review.locationRemarks: is really nice,, a lot place;s ,,restaurant's, shopping, center's, park;s,,,,,,store,,,,,near

review.title: can find better for the price
review.reviewText: place was pretty dirty and i feel a bit of a rip off.
review.locationRemarks: pretty good location in centro historico

review.title: OK hotel well located
review.reviewText: The price match the hotel, it's a good place for a couple nights
review.locationRemarks: Safety place half block from Alameda, so it has a great location

review.title: Nice hotel close to the downtown
review.reviewText:
I really liked the location of the hotel, close to bellas artes, zocalo and reforma.
Hot water runs better in the morning, after 3pm takes like 10 minutes to get hot.

review.title: terrible place. What a dump!
review.reviewText: Expedia shouldn't put this hotel on the website . It hurt the reputation of Expedia too
review.negativeRemarks: Destroy it and build a new one

review.title: Sorry but would not recommend for a family
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful. Room service was fast. Cleanliness of the room was horrible. We arrived at hotel and room was decent looking. No air conditioning and it was 90+F outside. Uncovered blankets & found hair on sheets & pillows. Bedcover had a stain on & smelled horrible. I called receptionist desk & they immediately brought clean sheets to us. They also brought a fan. Beds were very firm. Sorrt but I will not be staying there on my next trip to Mexico city. Also wifi only worked in the lobby. No wifi in the room

review.title: Not Recommended!
review.reviewText: This place is a dump. For 20 dollars more per night we moved to another hotel of a major Mexican chain. Bed frames and mattresses where disgusting , that's why we chose to move. We didn't even spend one night here. I've stayed at other 1 and 2 star hotels but they have to be clean. This place was old , dirty, and run down. You get what u pay for.

review.title: it is not clean
review.reviewText:
it is not clean. there is footprint on the pillow.
the location is the only advantage.

review.title: If you just need a place to sleep this is it
review.reviewText: I would reccomend this hotel for a 1-2 night stay. Everything is ok especially with the rates you can find through Expedia. Dont expect anything else than a good part of the city to sleep and great starting point to any activity in Mexico City. You wont have much time to be at a hotel if your in DF anyway. I ended ordering a Pastrami sandwhich from their restaurant one night that was delicious.
review.positiveRemarks: Near to plenty of attractions within walking distance
review.negativeRemarks: Bad smell throughout the floors and sometimes in the room

review.title: OK hotel in great location
review.reviewText:
OK place in a great location. There was 4 groups of boy and girls soccer teams so it was crowed but they handle it fine.
At first they gave me a 3 single beds room when we've asked 1-kingsize or something, but after the complain the gave us a better room (the only one left apparently)
review.negativeRemarks: They didn't have the key for the room, they said the last guest never return it, they should change to card-keys
review.locationRemarks: Next to Alameda Park, safe zone, 7-eleven at the corner, close walk to coffee shops and dinner places
